prompt: <description>Part 1 Construct a long, thin, rectangular object with a slightly curved top edge. Begin by creating a new coordinate system for part 1 with the given euler angles (0.0, 0.0, -90.0) and translation vector (0.0019, 0.0094, 0.0019). Create the 2D sketch for face_1. 1. Draw line_1 from (0.0, 0.0245) to (0.0002, 0.0151). 2. Draw line_2 from (0.0002, 0.0151) to (0.3729, 0.0). 3. Draw line_3 from (0.3729, 0.0) to (0.7461, 0.0151). 4. Draw line_4 from (0.7461, 0.0151) to (0.7459, 0.0245). 5. Draw line_5 from (0.7459, 0.0245) to (0.3729, 0.0245). 6. Draw line_6 from (0.3729, 0.0245) to (0.0, 0.0245). The loop is now closed. Scale the 2D sketch using the sketch_scale parameter (0.7461). Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model. Part 2 Construct a long, thin, cylindrical object with a slightly tapered end. It has a series of evenly spaced holes along its length. The object is symmetrical and appears to be made of a solid material. Begin by creating a new coordinate system for part 2 with the given euler angles (0.0, 0.0, -90.0) and translation vector (0.0, 0.0094, 0.0). Create the 2D sketch for face_1. 1. Draw line_1 from (0.0, 0.0282) to (0.0003, 0.0151). 2. Draw line_2 from (0.0003, 0.0151) to (0.3749, 0.0). 3. Draw line_3 from (0.3749, 0.0) to (0.75, 0.0151). 4. Draw line_4 from (0.75, 0.0151) to (0.7497, 0.0282). 5. Draw line_5 from (0.7497, 0.0282) to (0.0, 0.0282). The loop is now closed. Create the 2D sketch for face_1, loop_2. 1. Draw line_1 from (0.0019, 0.0264) to (0.0022, 0.0169). 2. Draw line_2 from (0.0022, 0.0169) to (0.3749, 0.0019). 3. Draw line_3 from (0.3749, 0.0019) to (0.7481, 0.0169). 4. Draw line_4 from (0.7481, 0.0169) to (0.7478, 0.0264). 5. Draw line_5 from (0.7478, 0.0264) to (0.0019, 0.0264). The loop is now closed. Scale the 2D sketch using the sketch_scale parameter (0.75). Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model. Perform the 'JoinFeatureOperation' to combine with the previous part.</description>
